comments:
Build ID: R2

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Install the Aperi R2 binary build on SLES10 sp1 beta2
2. Run the aperi startup script
3. GUI won't connect because server seems to have failed to start correctly.


More information:
Server is ready to accept connections on port 1527.

Robert, can you identify the JRE you're using for this? ('$JAVA_HOME/bin/java -version' should do it)

From SLES10 sp1 beta2:
java-1_5_0-ibm-1.5.0_sr3-13.4.rpm

The errors below result from trying to use the J9 (Java 2 Micro Edition) runtime environment, which won't work with Aperi. We require a Standard Edition runtime. Robert has confirmed that Aperi is running now, having switched to such an environment.
